text: Castanopsis microphylla is a tree in the family Fagaceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Greek meaning "small-leaved". ==Description== Castanopsis microphylla grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The bark is smooth, occasionally flaky. The coriaceous leaves measure up to long. Its ovoid nuts measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Castanopsis microphylla is endemic to Borneo. Its habitat is lowland dipterocarp to lower montane forests up to altitude. ==References== microphylla Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1968
title: Castanopsis microphylla
